Topic.Title: Microsoft Surface Pro Challenge

Message.Msg: I am having maybe the opposite experience you are looking for with all new W8 devices. I can no longer use all the older w7, XP machines that I run into because I am so used to swiping and flicking on the screen. No matter what old machine I use it is now too slow of an experience because of no touch screen that I constantly attempt to flick the screen on a non touch screen machine when I am on one. No matter how hard I try, it has become instinct to swipe and when I have to use the mouse or touchpad to sroll web pages it is a pain in the #$%$ now compared to W8. The tablet flat down bothers my neck. I guess it depends on age and you have body has been beat to heck. So don't get a Surface or a touch laptop if you want to use old machines again. It will seem like too much work when you have to switch back to W7 laptop. Really.

Topic.Title: Top Analyst UPGRADES Microsoft [MUST SEE REPORT]

Message.Msg: thanks

Message.Title: Insiders and institutions selling MSFT
Message.Msg: For example, see Yahoo's summary of insider and institutional activity. Over the past quarter, insider share sales outweighed insider purchases by a factor greater than 1,000. The result of this activity was that the number of shares held by insiders decreased by nearly 5%. As for institutional investors, much the same trend held true. Institutional holdings of MSFT shares decreased by about 4.6%

Message.Title: Went to best buy to check the Surface Pro -- people were pushing to play with it.
Message.Msg: love it.

Topic.Title: Insiders and institutions selling MSFT

Message.Msg: What's the point? you might well ask. Well, if you are considering buying MSFT, you might want to take into account that insiders and institutions have been selling at a rate which, if continued, would leave them almost entirely divested in five years. Perhaps they know something that you don't know.

Topic.Title: If You Don't Know Linux, You Better Learn Fast...93% of employers plan to hire Linux skills

Message.Msg: More spew from wally. Get a death, turd.

Topic.Title: MSFT is gaining fast momentum!

Message.Msg: lol.

Topic.Title: If You Don't Know Linux, You Better Learn Fast...93% of employers plan to hire Linux skills

Message.Msg: The world is run by Windows,SUX is for Q,U,E,E,R,S.

Message.Msg: All the kids played with it? But nobody bought it it!

Message.Msg: Why is that?

Message.Title: Why is Apple the largest computer seller in the world?
Message.Msg: Why is that?

Message.Title: Are Surface Pros selling? Any sales numbers?
Message.Msg: No news out there!

Topic.Title: Why is Apple the largest computer seller in the world?

Message.Msg: Suggest MSFT share holders look at the complimentary work Nokia is doing for W8. February 25 is the.date for the World Mobile Congress in Barcelona Spain. Nokia will present new mobile innovative phones using Microsoft Windows 8. This is in your best interests as desktop to mobile increases. This should be essential for Microsoft growth very soon. The variety is of better quality than the competition, better late than never.

Topic.Title: Went to best buy to check the Surface Pro -- people were pushing to play with it.

Message.Msg: You best go eat a D,O.N,G Troll.

Topic.Title: Are Surface Pros selling? Any sales numbers?

Message.Msg: I have a number for you D,O,N,G eater, 4Q.

Topic.Title: Are Surface Pros selling? Any sales numbers?

Message.Msg: Silly boy! No numbers, no credibility!

Topic.Title: Went to best buy to check the Surface Pro -- people were pushing to play with it.

Message.Msg: I guess you like playing with it too!

Topic.Title: Why is Apple the largest computer seller in the world?

Message.Msg: "...better late than never." Actually, never may be better than late, because a product that arrives too late is a waste of resources, because it cannot displace an already intrenched product if it is of merely equal merit.
